result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donya Maurice Johnson

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel contacted the Court and informs that he is in trial in Br 46 and would like to keep the previously scheduled date. Parties advised this jury trial date for today is vacated and are advised of the new date and time for this case. Case remains calendared in Br 15.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Donya Maurice Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial, first call. State is ready to proceed to trial. Defense informs the Court that he is in trial in Br. 46 with Judge Feiss as of now and he may not be able to proceed on this case today. Defense further informs the Court that this case is in a resolution posture and would like a plea and sentencing date. Court orders the parties to check in at 2:30PM to confirm that Defense is in fact in trial in Br 46. Court further orders a future plea and sentencing date set on Br 15 calendar incase Defense is in trial in Br 46. Case passed until 2:30PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude appeared by video for Donya Maurice Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waived defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel was recently appointed and has received discovery and offer and requests the Jury Trial remain calendared.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 15.
received and filed.
by attorney Jude

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability.
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel by Zoom, Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Donya Maurice Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion to withdraw as counsel. Due to a conflict of interest with the SPD office, Counsel motion to withdraw. SPD is in the process of finding defendant a private attorney that will take all of his pending matters. Counsel requests to keep the scheduled jury trial on the calendar with no objection from the state. Jury trial remains as calendared. Court grants defense motion to withdraw and set matter over for a status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
-received and filed.

Attorney Amanda Poznaski emailed the Court on 8/18/2022 requesting a motion hearing to address her motion to withdraw. Court allows scheduling of motiong hearing for 9/2/2022 at 9:00 a.m. Parties notified.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Jury Trial ( First Call).  Case remains in trial posture.  Parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.   

OFF THE RECORD: 
Court informs the parties a lower pending case has been selected. 
Court vacated today's Jury Trial  and ordered matter adjourned.    Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
  Jury trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court via Zoom with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Final Pretrial. State placed their offer on the record and rejected by Defense. Case remains in trial posture.
Court reviewed and addressed with the parties final pretrial documents. 
Parties advises the court there are no outstanding discovery issues remaining. 
Jury trial remains calendared for July 11th, 2022.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION IN LIMINE.
Received and Filed.
STATE'S Motion in Limine
STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.  
Defense advises the court case is in trial posture and  request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 72 hours in advance for the court to review 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
received and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donya Maurice Johnson in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 2:30p
